title: Boeing has become the centerpiece of Trump‚Äôs trade approach.
body: Boeing has become the unexpected centerpiece of Donald Trump‚Äôs entire global trade approach. Since he returned to the White House and restarted his tariff push in April, almost every country that reaches a new trade agreement with the U.S. ends up announcing a multi-billion-dollar Boeing jet order. The deals are precise and loaded with political calculation. When South Korean President Lee Jae Myung visited Washington, Korean Air dropped a $36.2 billion order for 103 Boeing jets. They added another $13.7 billion deal with GE Aerospace, making it the largest purchase in the airline‚Äôs history. Trade partners add Boeing deals after signing with Trump Japan followed suit right after their own trade agreement. They ordered 100 Boeing planes, though no price tag was made public. The playbook stayed the same in Southeast Asia. Malaysia, Indonesia, and Cambodia all included Boeing orders as part of their agreements with the Trump administration. Then in May, the UK threw down a $10 billion Boeing purchase tied to its trade deal with Washington. A few days later, on May 9, IAG, the parent company of British Airways, placed a separate 32-plane order worth $12.7 billion. John Grant, founder of aviation firm Midas Aviation, explained the reason planes keep showing up in Trump‚Äôs deals: ‚ÄúThe simple answer is that planes are high profile and Trump always wants profile.‚Äù He also said planes are ‚Äúvery visible statements of trade and have a high value,‚Äù which makes them ideal in these types of agreements. There‚Äôs also strategic convenience. Wendy Cutler, Vice President at the Asia Society Policy Institute, said high-value Boeing orders help governments show they‚Äôre working to reduce their trade surpluses with the U.S., the same reason Trump used to invoke emergency powers to launch tariffs in the first place. And not all imports go down easily. Aircraft are less likely to upset domestic industries than things like metals or farm goods. Homin Lee, a senior macro strategist at Lombard Odier, said, ‚ÄúImports of these airplanes are not politically difficult for most trading partners of the U.S., unlike metals or agricultural imports.‚Äù Boeing fits into Trump‚Äôs economic and political toolkit Japan protects its rice farmers. South Korea is one of the top steel exporters to the U.S. and doesn‚Äôt want to scale back. According to the U.S. International Trade Administration, Seoul was the fourth-largest steel exporter to the U.S. in 2024. So, Boeing becomes the easy trade chip. The long delivery times are another bonus. Boeing‚Äôs current production backlog is 11.5 years, while Airbus trails close behind at 10.6 years, per market researchers at Forecast International. This gives countries breathing room. They can commit now and space out the payments over a decade. But this isn‚Äôt just for show. Homin Lee said the planes are genuinely needed. The global tourism industry is growing again. The International Air Transport Association said airline profits are expected to hit $36 billion in 2025, up from $32.4 billion the year before. Margins are projected to climb to 3.7%, and overall revenue could top $979 billion. Still, the dominance of Boeing in all of this is not just economic, but also symbolic. Wendy Cutler said Boeing is ‚Äúan iconic American company.‚Äù And since Airbus is the only other player in the aircraft game, buying from the U.S. means buying from Boeing. Even with Boeing‚Äôs recent safety concerns, it remains central to Trump‚Äôs trade theater. In 2024, a door panel blew off on an Alaska Airlines flight. Whistleblowers flagged quality issues. Still, the company has made changes. Grant said those changes are already being noticed by airlines. And now, confidence seems to be rebounding. A Reuters report from June said airline executives are showing more faith in Boeing‚Äôs ability to deliver aircraft at the ‚Äúright quality.‚Äù No matter what industry critics say or how long the delivery window is, Trump‚Äôs trade playbook keeps coming back to Boeing. If a country wants a deal, they better want a plane. Don‚Äôt just read crypto news. Understand it. Subscribe to our newsletter. It's free .

title: Top Performing Crypto 2025: BlockDAG Presale Pulls Ahead of Chainlink, AAVE, and Arbitrum
body: Which projects are really proving themselves in 2025? With so many tokens competing for attention, it helps to focus on those showing adoption, results, and momentum. Right now, four names are on everyone‚Äôs radar: BlockDAG, Chainlink, AAVE, and Arbitrum. Each is driving attention for different reasons, but together they highlight where the strongest traction is happening. Some are delivering years of consistent growth, while others are breaking records in presale numbers and adoption speed. Investors looking for the top performing crypto have clear choices in this group. The question is which one offers the biggest upside going forward. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at what makes these four stand out and why BlockDAG is drawing the loudest buzz. 1. BlockDAG Sets Records Before Launch BlockDAG has turned its presale into the largest in years, raising over $400 million and selling more than 25.8 billion BDAG coins so far. The presale is in its final phase, with the price locked at $0.0013 until the Singapore Deployment Event with Coinstore. With a target of $600 million in sight, this project has positioned itself as the top performing crypto in presale history. Community proof is everywhere. More than 19,600 hardware miners have been sold, with 13,000 already shipping globally through DHL. Videos of users unboxing X10, X30, and X100 miners are going viral, showing real adoption in action. Over 3 million people are mining BDAG on the X1 mobile app, and the holder base has crossed 320,000. Growth is accelerating, with over 1,000 new holders joining daily. On the tech side, BlockDAG runs a hybrid DAG plus PoW architecture that is faster, more scalable, and EVM compatible. With a CertiK audit completed, 4,500 developers already building, and 300+ dApps in the pipeline, the foundations are strong. Add global sponsorships with Inter Milan and U.S. sports teams plus viral billboard campaigns, and BlockDAG is proving adoption at a scale no presale has managed before. 2. Chainlink‚Äôs Steady Expansion Chainlink continues to be one of the most reliable projects for connecting blockchains with real-world data. The LINK token has consistently shown strength during market rebounds, thanks to its role as the leading oracle provider. Developers depend on Chainlink to bring off-chain data like prices and weather into smart contracts, which is essential for DeFi, insurance, and countless other use cases. Its growing number of integrations has helped it stay relevant while newer projects try to catch up. In terms of price action, LINK has built strong support zones and often becomes a reference point for judging how secure oracle adoption is across crypto. Analysts continue to see it as a backbone technology for decentralized applications. While it doesn‚Äôt have the viral presale hype of BlockDAG, its staying power and institutional-level partnerships give it a unique edge. For those tracking the top performing crypto, Chainlink remains a core pick. 3. AAVE‚Äôs DeFi Power AAVE has cemented itself as one of the top DeFi lending protocols, allowing users to lend, borrow, and earn yields on their crypto holdings. Its governance token, AAVE, gives holders influence over protocol upgrades and decisions, keeping the ecosystem community-driven. The protocol has expanded its offerings to include flash loans and more sophisticated lending tools, helping it retain leadership in the decentralized finance sector. While price swings have been part of its journey, AAVE has shown resilience by continuing to build during market downturns. Liquidity remains strong, and its multi-chain expansion has attracted both retail and institutional interest. As more investors look for proven DeFi platforms, AAVE remains a trusted choice. In discussions of the top performing crypto, it consistently earns mention for its balance of innovation, adoption, and long-term value creation within the lending market. 4. Arbitrum‚Äôs Layer-2 Strength Arbitrum is now one of Ethereum‚Äôs most important scaling solutions, processing large volumes of transactions at lower costs compared to the base layer. Its rollup technology has gained massive adoption from dApps, DeFi platforms, and NFT projects looking for cheaper and faster transactions without leaving the Ethereum ecosystem. The ARB token fuels governance and incentivizes further growth within the network. Price action for ARB has reflected its role as a core scaling project, with investors betting on Ethereum‚Äôs success translating into Arbitrum‚Äôs continued relevance. Adoption across DeFi platforms and steady transaction volumes show its strength as more users look to cut costs. While competition from other Layer-2s is intense, Arbitrum‚Äôs ecosystem is expanding at pace. Investors who see Ethereum as central to the future of crypto often view ARB as an essential part of their portfolio of top performing crypto assets. Summing Up From presale leaders to established networks, these four names highlight what momentum looks like in 2025. Chainlink keeps expanding its role as the bridge between blockchains and the real world. AAVE powers lending markets with innovation that has stood the test of multiple cycles. Arbitrum continues to scale Ethereum, proving Layer-2 adoption is here to stay. But BlockDAG is different, delivering adoption, hardware shipments, and presale growth on a historic scale. With 3 million mobile miners, 320,000 holders, and viral marketing proof, it has made a case as the top performing crypto of the year even before listing. For investors searching for opportunity, BlockDAG is showing what real-time adoption and FOMO look like in one package. The post Top Performing Crypto 2025: BlockDAG Presale Pulls Ahead of Chainlink, AAVE, and Arbitrum appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

title: SWIFT GPI vs Ripple Payments: XRP Army Needs to See This
body: Crypto researcher SMQKE recently shared a post comparing SWIFT GPI to Ripple Payments. The tweet captioned a video in which a speaker outlined the contrasts between SWIFT‚Äôs Global Payments Innovation (GPI) service and Ripple‚Äôs blockchain-based payment technology. The commentary assessed the strengths and limitations of both systems, focusing on infrastructure, processing speed, adoption levels, and industry influence. SWIFT GPI vs Ripple Payments. Watch. pic.twitter.com/QLmCf21YNN ‚Äî SMQKE (@SMQKEDQG) September 7, 2025 Ripple‚Äôs Impact on SWIFT‚Äôs Evolution The video began with the assertion that Ripple has acted as a direct alternative to SWIFT, describing Ripple as ‚Äúa new technology.‚Äù According to the speaker, Ripple‚Äôs entry into the payments space has forced SWIFT to adapt and modernize its infrastructure. He stated that Ripple ‚Äúhas forced SWIFT to improve payment processing standards, which have previously been ignored or taken for granted by SWIFT.‚Äù This highlighted how Ripple‚Äôs innovation has accelerated progress within the cross-border payment industry. The video emphasized that Ripple approaches payment processing challenges with different methods, specifically through blockchain and the Interledger Protocol (ILP). By contrast, SWIFT‚Äôs updates through GPI still rely on its longstanding infrastructure, which the speaker described as less disruptive compared to blockchain solutions. Infrastructure and Technology Differences A key section of the video addressed the technological gap between the two systems. SWIFT‚Äôs GPI tracker provides visibility in cross-border payments but still depends on existing, decades-old infrastructure. Ripple, meanwhile, is built on blockchain technology, which offers advantages in transparency and security. The speaker noted, however, that blockchain remains unproven at scale, particularly in terms of the framework‚Äôs capacity to support global financial traffic. Processing Speed and Payment Finality One of the most significant contrasts highlighted was in transaction speed. According to the analysis, SWIFT GPI can deliver payments within a window of 30 minutes to 24 hours. Ripple‚Äôs system, by comparison, confirms payment finality within seconds . The speaker described this as a ‚Äúhuge difference in terms of the processing time,‚Äù framing Ripple‚Äôs settlement efficiency as a major technical advantage over SWIFT. Adoption and Network Reach Despite Ripple‚Äôs strengths in speed and innovation, the video highlighted that SWIFT continues to lead in global adoption. With a network of over 11,000 financial institutions , SWIFT retains unmatched reach in the payments industry. The speaker explained that while Ripple has secured partnerships, its adoption remains limited, citing that around 45 financial institutions currently have Ripple‚Äôs system in place. This disparity highlights a central issue: Ripple‚Äôs technology demonstrates efficiency advantages, but SWIFT‚Äôs established global infrastructure provides it with a significant lead in real-world applications and integration across the financial system. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 SMQKE‚Äôs tweet and the accompanying video highlighted the contrasting characteristics of SWIFT GPI and Ripple payments. Ripple‚Äôs blockchain-based model offers faster settlement times and a modern technological framework, but it faces challenges in scalability and adoption. SWIFT, while slower, maintains dominance through its extensive global network and recent improvements to its payment systems. The video suggested that Ripple‚Äôs innovation has played a role in driving SWIFT to upgrade its services, presenting a competitive dynamic that continues to shape the future of cross-border payments. title: Injective price jumps 5% as Pineapple Financial commits $100M to INJ staking
body: Injective has confirmed that Nasdaq-listed fintech firm Pineapple Financial has officially closed its $100 million fundraise to buy and stake native INJ. The development has sparked excitement among cryptocurrency enthusiasts, with INJ gaining over 5% in the past 24 hours. Pineapple Financial will cooperate with institutional-level asset managers to begin accumulating Injective tokens this month. The program includes buying Injective assets in the upcoming weeks until Pineapple exhausts the entire $100 million. The announcement highlighted: Purchases will be publicly revealed and will be executed by institutional asset managers in the open market, with the accumulation program expected to continue over the coming weeks until the full $100 million worth of INJ is acquired. Injective ü•∑ @injective ¬∑ Follow Pineapple Financial has officially completed its $100 Million capital raise to purchase $INJ .Starting this month, Pineapple will accumulate $INJ tokens and stake them with the aim of generating an estimated 12% annual yield, placing its strategy well ahead of major digital Watch on Twitter View replies 7:29 PM ¬∑ Sep 8, 2025 3 Reply Copy link Read more on Twitter At prevailing market prices, the $100 million investment would mean acquiring around 7% of INJ‚Äôs circulating supply, making Pineapple among the top Injective holders. Staking approach with long-term goals Indeed, the blockchain space has witnessed increased appetite for crypto treasuries in the past months. While most corporates spread associated risks across several assets, Pineapple plans to go all-in on INJ. The company will stake its investment to generate a roughly 12% yearly yield. That strategy would put Pineapple Financial well ahead of many renowned crypto treasury approaches. Besides targeting more yields, the focused approach aligns Pineapple‚Äôs credibility with Injective‚Äôs growth vision. The company remains dedicated to making INJ the central asset for its monetary strategies in the coming years. Injective‚Äôs tokenomics spark interest Meanwhile, such narratives indicate unwavering confidence in the altcoin‚Äôs long-term potential. Besides futuristic developments in the AI field , Injective‚Äôs tokenomics likely fueled Pineapple‚Äôs move. Unlike most cryptocurrencies, INJ doesn‚Äôt have impending token unlocks for private investors. That eliminates dilution risks and unexpected volatility in the future. All Injective tokens are already in circulation, allowing Pineapple Financial to build its crypto portfolio without lingering concerns. Moreover, Injective uses its on-chain revenue to burn tokens. It has removed over 6.7 million INJ tokens from supply. Pineapple‚Äôs continuous accumulation and staking amidst the blockchain‚Äôs pursuit for scarcity sets the stage for impressive growth for the network and its native token. INJ price outlook Injective painted its 24-hour chart green after the announcement, gaining 5.6% from $13.04 to $13.77 intraday. The alt has retraced from the peaks to $13.62 at press time, with the recovering trading volume hinting at continued surges. Chart by Coinmarketcap Bullish technical indicators such as the MACD and the RSI support extended rallies for INJ in the near-term, with buyers targeting resistance around $15. Meanwhile, prevailing broader sentiments will influence INJ‚Äôs short-term performance. However, the emerging institutional interest positions the token for significant rallies amid market recoveries. Other companies might follow Pineapple‚Äôs move to invest in Injective, considering the alt‚Äôs lucrative tokenomics . title: Sky Pitches Genius-Compliant USDH Stablecoin With $8B Balance Sheet and 4.85% Yield
body: The battle over who will issue Hyperliquid‚Äôs native stablecoin , USDH, has a new heavyweight entrant. Sky, formerly known as MakerDAO, submitted a proposal to power USDH that leans on its $8 billion balance sheet, seven-year operating history, and a B- S&P credit rating ‚Äì the first ever issued to a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol. Hyperliquid, which handled nearly $400 billion in trading volume last month, has invited issuers to compete for the right to deploy USDH. The exchange holds $5.5 billion in USDC deposits, roughly 7.5% of that stablecoin‚Äôs supply, making the contract one of the most lucrative in DeFi. Validators are set to vote on September 14, with the Hyperliquid Foundation abstaining. Sky‚Äôs proposal highlights features few rivals can match. It offers 4.85% returns on all USDH held on Hyperliquid, a rate above Treasury bills, with revenue earmarked for HYPE buybacks and the Assistance Fund. It also pledges $2.2 billion in instant redemption liquidity through its Peg Stability Module, giving institutional traders confidence they can move in and out at scale. Beyond yield and liquidity, Sky is promising ecosystem investment. Its proposal includes a $25 million ‚ÄúHyperliquid Genesis Star,‚Äù modeled after Spark, a token farm within Sky that has attracted more than $1 billion in TVL. Sky said this would bootstrap DeFi on Hyperliquid and potentially attract billions in deposits. The protocol also pledged to migrate its native buyback engine, with more than $250 million in annual profits, onto Hyperliquid. Other bidders have framed their offers differently. Paxos pledged 95% of reserve earnings to HYPE buybacks alongside a zero-fee USDC migration. Frax offered a ‚Äúcommunity-first‚Äù wrapper model where 100% of Treasury yield would flow directly to users. Agora, backed by State Street, VanEck, and MoonPay, promised 100% of net revenue into HYPE buybacks and stressed neutrality. Native Markets, aligned with Stripe‚Äôs Bridge , has faced community pushback over potential conflicts of interest tied to Stripe‚Äôs Tempo blockchain and its ownership of wallet provider Privy. With Ethena hinting at its own bid , validators face a crowded field when they head to the virtual polls in a few days. The decision will determine not only how USDH is structured, Genius-compliant, user-yielding, or Hyper-native, but also whether Hyperliquid‚Äôs monetary layer is tied to a legacy stablecoin giant, a DeFi-native upstart, or a corporate payments firm with blockchain ambitions.

title: Solana (SOL) Rally Builds ‚Äì Can Bulls Extend Gains Beyond Key Levels?
body: Solana started a fresh increase above the $212 zone. SOL price is now consolidating above $210 and might aim for more gains above the $218 zone. SOL price started a fresh upward move above the $202 and $210 levels against the US Dollar. The price is now trading above $210 and the 100-hourly simple moving average. There is a bullish trend line forming with support at $212 on the hourly chart of the SOL/USD pair (data source from Kraken). The pair could extend gains if it clears the $218 resistance zone. Solana Price Eyes Additional Gains Solana price started a decent increase after it found support near the $200 zone, beating Bitcoin and Ethereum . SOL climbed above the $205 level to enter a short-term positive zone. The price even smashed the $212 resistance. The bulls were able to push the price above the $215 barrier. A high was formed at $218 and the price is consolidating gains. There was a minor drop below the 23.6% Fib retracement level of the upward move from the $199 swing low to the $217 high. Solana is now trading above $210 and the 100-hourly simple moving average. There is also a bullish trend line forming with support at $212 on the hourly chart of the SOL/USD pair. On the upside, the price is facing resistance near the $218 level. The next major resistance is near the $220 level. The main resistance could be $232. A successful close above the $232 resistance zone could set the pace for another steady increase. The next key resistance is $244. Any more gains might send the price toward the $250 level. Downside Correction In SOL? If SOL fails to rise above the $218 resistance, it could start another decline. Initial support on the downside is near the $212 zone. The first major support is near the $208 level or the 50% Fib retracement level of the upward move from the $199 swing low to the $217 high. A break below the $208 level might send the price toward the $204 support zone. If there is a close below the $204 support, the price could decline toward the $200 support in the near term. Technical Indicators Hourly MACD ‚Äì The MACD for SOL/USD is gaining pace in the bullish zone. Hourly Hours RSI (Relative Strength Index) ‚Äì The RSI for SOL/USD is above the 50 level. Major Support Levels ‚Äì $212 and $208. Major Resistance Levels ‚Äì $218 and $220.

title: PENGU Bottom In? TD Sequential and Wedge Breakout Say Yes
body: TL;DR TD Sequential prints a 9-buy signal after weeks of decline, hinting at potential trend reversal. The asset breaks out of a falling wedge, confirming bullish structure and lifting PENGU into the previous range. Analysts are watching $0.042 as the next key resistance after a 13% gain and strong short-term buying interest. TD Sequential Signals a Buy on 3-Day Chart A new buy signal has appeared for PENGU on the 3-day chart using the TD Sequential indicator. Shared by crypto analyst Ali Martinez, the indicator printed a ‚Äú9‚Äù candle, which often appears at the end of a downtrend. It suggests that sellers may be losing momentum. Meanwhile, the signal is shown with a gray upward arrow below the latest candle. Martinez posted, ‚Äú$PENGU is a BUY right now, per the TD Sequential indicator.‚Äù These setups are usually watched for early signs of a bounce or shift in trend. The signal follows several weeks of declining price action. $PENGU is a BUY right now, per the TD Sequential indicator! pic.twitter.com/KDwOwZ5nG9 ‚Äî Ali (@ali_charts) September 8, 2025 At the time of writing, PENGU trades at $0.035. The asset is up 15% over the past 24 hours and has gained 20% over the last seven days. The move comes after a drop from the $0.035‚Äì$0.038 area in mid-August, with the price reaching a low near $0.0287 before rebounding . Recent candles have had smaller bodies and lower volatility. This pattern often suggests that selling pressure is easing. There are also lower wicks on the candles, pointing to buying interest at lower levels. These details support the idea that the market may be forming a short-term base. Breakout Observed on 12-Hour Timeframe On the 12-hour chart, analyst Sjuul shared a breakout from a falling wedge formation. The pattern had been in place throughout August. Price recently moved above the wedge resistance, while holding within a demand zone that had been tested several times. Sjuul referred to the move as ‚Äú another perfect bottom call ,‚Äù saying that the token is ‚Äú now pumping and going places .‚Äù The breakout has pushed the price into the middle of the previous range. If momentum holds, the next area to watch is the resistance near $0.042. Market Watchers Discuss Potential Upside CryptoBull_360 mentioned that PENGU is trading near the point of control within a descending triangle setup. He said that ‚Äúsustained consolidation above this zone could spark a short-term rally of 30‚Äì40%.‚Äù He also pointed to rising volume as something to keep an eye on. Livercoin commented , ‚ÄúThe only meme IP I keep seeing IRL and in popular non-crypto content,‚Äù adding that he is hoping for a pullback before any next leg higher. The post PENGU Bottom In? TD Sequential and Wedge Breakout Say Yes appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: DOGE Price Action Shows 5.7% Swing as Traders Eye 25-Cents Target
body: Dogecoin swung violently over the last 24 hours, with whales and institutional desks stepping in on heavy volumes near $0.234 support. The memecoin advanced 2% in the final hour to recover from steep intraday selling, though resistance at $0.244 remains firm. Price Action Summary ‚Ä¢ DOGE traded between $0.231 and $0.244 from September 8 at 04:00 to September 9 at 03:00, a 5.7% range. ‚Ä¢ Early momentum carried price to a $0.244 peak, but heavy profit-taking reversed gains by session close at $0.236. ‚Ä¢ Volumes spiked to 463.5M tokens during rejection at $0.244, showing strong institutional selling. ‚Ä¢ Late-session support emerged between $0.234‚Äì$0.237, with 687.9M tokens exchanged, suggesting accumulation. ‚Ä¢ Final hour recovery lifted DOGE from $0.234 to $0.237 (+1.3%) as volume averaged 6.2M per minute. Technical Analysis ‚Ä¢ Support: $0.234‚Äì$0.237 zone confirmed by heavy buying into late-session declines. ‚Ä¢ Resistance: $0.244 level rejected multiple times on large volume, capping upside momentum. ‚Ä¢ Short-term momentum: Higher lows during the last 20 minutes indicate fresh bullish bias. ‚Ä¢ Key signal: Break above $0.244 could target $0.250, while failure risks retest of $0.231 base. News Background ‚Ä¢ Futures data show heightened open interest in DOGE contracts as institutions hedge spot exposure. ‚Ä¢ Market participants anticipate U.S. regulatory progress on crypto ETFs, keeping DOGE in speculative flows. ‚Ä¢ Broader volatility stems from Fed policy expectations and global trade tensions impacting risk assets. What Traders Are Watching ‚Ä¢ Whether DOGE can sustain closes above $0.240 and flip $0.244 into support, opening path toward $0.250. ‚Ä¢ How Fed‚Äôs September 17 rate decision impacts risk appetite and liquidity conditions across crypto. ‚Ä¢ Whale wallet inflows, with institutional desks observed accumulating during late-session dips. ‚Ä¢ Progress on U.S. DOGE-related ETF filings and whether regulators signal clearer guidance on meme coin products.

title: Asia-Pacific stocks rose and the U.S. dollar weakened
body: Asia-Pacific shares pushed higher on Tuesday on hopes the U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates as soon as next week, even as political tensions and policy risks kept currency and bond markets cautious. MSCI‚Äôs index of Asia-Pacific stocks outside Japan rose 0.2% in early dealings, after a strong Wall Street day that ended with a Nasdaq record. In New York, the S&P 500 rose 0.2%, just shy of last week‚Äôs record. The Dow added 114 points (0.3%), and the Nasdaq gained 0.5% to a new record. Pricing in futures shows just over a 10% chance of a 50bp cut this month, up from none a week ago, according to the CME FedWatch tool. European equity futures softened after cash-market gains on Monday. EUROSTOXX 50 futures slipped 0.17%, FTSE futures eased 0.04%, and DAX futures dipped 0.22%. Japan‚Äôs Nikkei 225 rose almost 0.3% to 43,763.96; Australia‚Äôs ASX 200 fell 0.5% to 8,806.60; South Korea‚Äôs Kospi climbed 0.6% to 3,238.07; Hong Kong‚Äôs Hang Seng added 1.2% to 25,949.48; the Shanghai Composite edged up 0.1% to 3,831.45. In currencies, the yen rose 0.1% to 147.37 per dollar, undoing yesterday‚Äôs drop, while the euro was steady at $1.1768. Japanese government bond yields fell after rising a day earlier, since prices and yields move opposite each other. The U.S. dollar dropped to its lowest level in nearly seven weeks on Tuesday as per Reuters . U.S. yields stood near their lowest point The two-year Treasury yield , sensitive to policy expectations, hovered near a five-month bottom at 3.4966%. The benchmark 10-year was likewise near a five-month trough at 4.0494%. The 10-year Treasury yield eased to 4.04% from 4.10% late Friday and from 4.28% last Tuesday. Commodities were mixed. In energy trading, benchmark U.S. crude rose 25 cents to $62.51 a barrel, and Brent crude gained 27 cents to $66.29. Gold notched another record on Tuesday as traders ramped up bets on multiple Fed cuts this year. Spot bullion rose as much as 0.3% to a new all-time high above $3,647 an ounce, topping Monday‚Äôs peak as noted by Cryptopolitan The metal had climbed 2.5% over the previous two sessions after Friday‚Äôs surprisingly weak payrolls led markets to price in three cuts this year, including a quarter-point move at next week‚Äôs Fed meeting. Because gold does not pay interest, it often benefits when borrowing costs fall. The rally has lifted gold nearly 40% this year, supported by purchases from central banks, expectations of easier policy, safe-haven demand amid geopolitical strains, and concern about the impact of President Donald Trump‚Äôs tariff regime on the world economy. As of 9:51 a.m. in Singapore, bullion traded at $3,645.61 an ounce. Global Bond index jumps 20% since 2022 A widely followed gauge has surged more than 20% from its 2022 low as softer U.S. labor data reinforced the case for faster Fed easing. ‚ÄúCurves have been highly directional and that too has brought about a grab for yield, that perhaps also was driven by fairly significant shorts placed in the US market as seen in surveys,‚Äù said Martin Whetton, head of financial markets strategy at Westpac Banking Corporation. Even with the recovery, longer-dated debt faces pressure from fiscal concerns. France‚Äôs prime minister has warned of a debt crisis as the government faces strain, while in the UK investors are waiting for Chancellor Rachel Reeves‚Äôs November plan to balance growth measures with spending restraint. The smartest crypto minds already read our newsletter. Want in? Join them .

title: Ethereum Bleeds $912M in Outflows ‚Äì 7 Straight Days of Investor Exodus
body: Last week, digital asset investment products shed $352 million, as investors remained cautious despite a supportive backdrop of softer US payrolls and growing expectations for a September rate cut. Alongside, trading volumes tumbled 27% week-over-week, in what appears to be signs of waning short-term interest. Even so, year-to-date inflows climbed $35.2 billion, outpacing last year‚Äôs $48.5 billion annual tally by 4.2% on an annualized basis, which, according to CoinShares, points to the broader positive sentiment being intact. Ethereum Hit Hardest Although market sentiment weakened and minor outflows occurred later in the week, Bitcoin still ended with strong results, as it recorded net inflows of $524 million over the week, according to the latest edition of Digital Asset Fund Flows Weekly Report. Ethereum, however, bore the brunt of last week‚Äôs downturn in digital asset products, posting $912 million in net outflows. Withdrawals were logged every day of the seven-day trading stretch and came from a diverse range of ETP providers, which ultimately erased monthly inflows. Despite this reversal, Ethereum still holds $11.2 billion in year-to-date inflows. On the other hand, Solana and XRP continue to post encouraging numbers. Solana has seen 21 consecutive weeks of inflows worth $1.16 billion, while XRP leads slightly with $1.22 billion. Meanwhile, Chainlink, Sui, and Cronos attracted $1 million, $0.6 million, and $0.3 million in inflows, respectively. Multi-asset products also welcomed $4.4 million in weekly inflows. Flows were highly polarized across regions during the week. The United States, for one, topped the outflow charts with $440 million, joined by Sweden‚Äôs $13.5 million and Switzerland‚Äôs $2.7 million. Germany countered with inflows of $85.1 million, while Hong Kong attracted $8.1 million. Smaller but positive inflows were also seen in Canada, Brazil, and Australia, which pulled in $4.1 million, $3.5 million, and $2.1 million, respectively. Ethereum Outflows Aren‚Äôt About Fundamentals Weighing on the pressure on Ethereum, Konstantin Anissimov, Global CEO of Currency.com, said that some of these outflows are rotations. In a statement to CryptoPotato , Anissimov added that macro anxiety amid soft labour data, recession fears push money back to Bitcoin products. The exec commented, ‚ÄúTo many institutions, Bitcoin still looks like the ‚Äòsafer‚Äô digital asset when markets face turbulence. By contrast, ETH is seen as a higher-beta play. That makes it the first target when risk appetite decreases.‚Äù Despite this, the exec does not believe that the ‚Äúfundamentals behind Ethereum have cracked.‚Äù Anissimov went on to add, ‚ÄúSo far, staking growth, DeFi activity, and network health remain strong. From my perspective, the size of this outflow is more about timing than conviction. If ETH stabilises and macro sentiment improves, inflows can bounce back by Q4. But if uncertainty stays strong, we could be looking at a much longer pause being a stress test for ETF investors and ETH‚Äôs price resilience.‚Äù The post Ethereum Bleeds $912M in Outflows ‚Äì 7 Straight Days of Investor Exodus appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: SwissBorg Hit by $41M Solana Theft in Kiln API Compromise
body: The company clarified that only 1% of users were affected and pledged full reimbursement. Meanwhile, a massive supply chain hack targeting JavaScript libraries downloaded over a billion times, but surprisingly only netted attackers less than $50 in stolen crypto. However, experts warned that the potential risks are still significant. Hackers Steal $41M in SOL from SwissBorg SwissBorg, a Switzerland-based crypto wealth management platform, confirmed that it suffered a security breach involving its staking partner Kiln that resulted in the theft of about 193,000 Solana tokens. The exploit targeted Kiln‚Äôs API, and drained funds from SwissBorg‚Äôs Solana Earn program which amounted to roughly $41 million at the time of the incident. Despite the scale of the hack, SwissBorg explained that its app and other Earn products were unaffected, with the vulnerability traced back to Kiln‚Äôs infrastructure rather than its own systems. API attacks like this one exploit the software bridge that enables communication between different systems. In this case, Kiln‚Äôs API was compromised, which allowed hackers to manipulate requests and siphon tokens meant for staking on the Solana network. SwissBorg stated that the breach only impacted users who deposited Solana into its Earn program, which makes up about 1% of its customer base and 2% of total assets under management. CEO Cyrus Fazel addressed the issue in an X Space , and admitted that the loss was big but it did not threaten the company‚Äôs overall financial stability. Cyrus Fazel during an X Space addressing the hack The Solana Earn program, powered by Kiln, was designed to make staking simple for retail investors who might not want to deal with the complexities of running validator nodes or engaging directly with DeFi protocols. While the attack was a setback, SwissBorg reassured its customers that affected users will be reimbursed. The company also pointed out that its treasury reserves were strong enough to cover losses immediately and pledged to move forward with reimbursements while continuing to work with international agencies, exchanges, and white-hat hackers to trace and block stolen funds. Blockchain data shows that the stolen assets were routed to a Solana wallet now flagged on Solscan as belonging to the ‚ÄúSwissBorg Exploiter.‚Äù The company advised users to avoid interacting with this address during their investigations. Fazel described the incident as ‚Äúa bad day for SwissBorg,‚Äù but one that will ultimately serve as a learning experience. Despite the disruption, SwissBorg said daily operations remain unaffected, and its broader suite of crypto yield products is still intact. $50 Lost in Supply Chain Hack Meanwhile, hackers have managed to steal less than $50 worth of crypto in what researchers are calling a massive supply chain attack targeting JavaScript software libraries. According to security intelligence platform Security Alliance , attackers broke into the node package manager (NPM) account of a well-known developer and inserted malware into popular libraries downloaded more than a billion times. The breach specifically targeted Ethereum and Solana wallets, but so far the actual damage has been minimal. Security Alliance revealed that the only malicious address it has identified, an Ethereum wallet labeled ‚Äú0xFc4a48,‚Äù received just a handful of tokens including ETH and several meme coins like Brett, Andy, Dork Lord, Ethervista, and Gondola. Initially, the value of the compromised funds was reported at just five cents, before climbing to around $50 as more small transfers were detected. The relatively tiny haul prompted Security Alliance to say that hackers squandered what could have been one of the most damaging supply chain exploits in the industry‚Äôs history. The attack involved packages like chalk, strip-ansi, and color-convert, which are deeply embedded in the dependency chains of countless projects. This means even developers who never installed the compromised packages directly may still be exposed if their projects depend on them indirectly. The malware that was planted appears to be a crypto-clipper, which is designed to silently swap out wallet addresses during transactions to siphon funds. Despite the low dollar impact so far, experts are urging caution. Ledger‚Äôs chief technology officer Charles Guillemet advised users to carefully verify on-chain transactions, but Ledger confirmed its hardware devices were not directly affected. Meanwhile, 0xngmi, founder of DeFiLlama, mentioned that only crypto projects that updated after the malicious NPM code was pushed are at risk, and even then, users would need to approve the compromised transactions for funds to be taken. Still, he thinks that users may want to avoid interacting with crypto websites until developers confirm that their platforms are no longer relying on infected libraries. Although the outcome so far seems like a missed opportunity for attackers, the sheer scale of the breach shed some light on the fragility of supply chain security in open-source software and how deeply even small libraries are integrated into critical crypto infrastructure.

title: Upbit introduces GIWA as an Ethereum Layer 2 to lower costs and speed up transactions
body: Upbit, South Korea‚Äôs largest crypto exchange, has launched GIWA, a new Ethereum Layer 2 blockchain that makes Web3 faster, cheaper, and easier for everyday users. GIWA, short for Global Infrastructure for Web3 Access, runs on the OP Stack, an open-source system managed by the Optimism Foundatio n. The blockchain delivers one-second block times, near-real-time transactions, and full support for Ethereum tools and smart contracts, so developers and users can use it easily. Upbit builds GIWA to grow South Korea‚Äôs Web3 market Upbit‚Äôs parent company, Dunamu, filed multiple trademark applications under ‚ÄúGIWA.‚Äù These filings hinted that the company was about to release something big, and they even added a countdown clock on the website for the Upbit Developer Conference (UDC). Users, traders, and developers were all excited for weeks, and when GIWA finally came out, it showed that Upbit was ready to move beyond being just an exchange. Like Coinbase with Base, OKX with OKChain, and Binance with its BNB Chain, Upbit ‚Äòs new blockchain would give the platform more control over its ecosystems and support faster innovation in Web3. Upbit wants to simplify Web3 in South Korea and make it accessible for everyday users by providing a fast and affordable blockchain that easily connects with the developer tools on Ethereum. With Upbit‚Äôs influence in Korea, experts believe that many traders will jump on board if the company uses GIWA to launch new tokens. GIWA speeds up Ethereum and adds simple identity tools GIWA was designed to solve Ethereum‚Äôs slow transaction periods and high gas fees that rise when the servers are overloaded. Instead of replacing ETH, GIWA works as a Layer 2 network. This means most transactions happen on its own system and are then recorded back onto Ethereum. This way, users won‚Äôt have to deal with Ethereum‚Äôs performance issues but will still enjoy its tight security features. GIWA is also fully compatible with ETH‚Äôs system, which runs smart contracts like the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). This makes it easier for developers to deploy their smart contracts from Solidity (the standard programming language for Ethereum) onto GIWA without rewriting or making big changes. They can also use the same tools and development frameworks they already know. In this way, GIWA attracts more developers looking for faster speeds and lower fees without starting from scratch. GIWA also comes with a GIWA ID built as a Soulbound Token, or SBT (a special type of token that cannot be transferred or traded once issued) for digital wallets. Users with a GIWA ID get verified, and their identity is locked to the original wallet so it cannot be sold or misused. And if a user has issues with their verification, GIWA offers a 90-day grace period for them to fix it before revocation. While GIWA is still in development, the team launched a public testnet so developers can experiment and test their applications in a live space. The testnet works on chainId 91342 through an RPC endpoint and a blockchain explorer. This means developers can connect, deploy contracts, and track transactions like in the main network. Want your project in front of crypto‚Äôs top minds? Feature it in our next industry report, where data meets impact.

title: Bitcoin Exchange Upbit Announces Listing of This Altcoin on Its Spot Trading Platform! Here Are the Details
body: South Korea-based global digital asset exchange Upbit announced that it will open trading of the FLock.io (FLOCK) token in KRW pair on September 9, 2025. Upbit to List KRW Trading Pair for FLock.io (FLOCK) According to the statement, FLOCK will be supported via the Base network and transactions will begin at 12:00 CET. The exchange emphasized that users can only make deposits and withdrawals via the specified network (FLOCK-Base). Transactions made via other networks will not be supported, and the turnaround time may be lengthy. Additionally, FLOCK's official contract address was shared as 0x5ab3d4c385b400f3abb49e80de2faf6a88a7b691. Upbit will implement various temporary trading restrictions for market security during the trading opening. Buy orders will be blocked for the first five minutes after trading begins, and sell orders will not be allowed for a price 10% below the previous day's closing price for the same period. Additionally, only limit orders will be allowed for the first two hours. The previous day's closing price of FLOCK on the Upbit BTC market was set at 0.00000279 BTC (435.4 KRW). FLock.io stands out as a project that aims to democratize AI development through on-chain incentive mechanisms. Participants can earn rewards by contributing models, data, and computational power. The FLOCK token will be used for staking, rewards, and governance within the ecosystem. Upbit also reminded that new asset listings aim to improve the user experience, but the start of trading may be delayed depending on market conditions. *This is not investment advice. title: Whales Buying the Dip ‚Äî XRP Poised to Power Real-Time SWIFT Settlements
body: Whale Accumulation Sends XRP Momentum Soaring as MFI Breaks Above 60 According to renowned market analyst Xaif Crypto, Ripple‚Äôs native token XRP is flashing a strong bullish signal after its Money Flow Index (MFI) surged past the key 60 threshold. This technical development suggests that whales, large institutional and high-net-worth investors, are actively accumulating XRP during recent market dips, setting the stage for potential upside momentum. The MFI, often referred to as a volume-weighted version of the Relative Strength Index (RSI), tracks both price and trading volume to identify overbought and oversold conditions. An MFI reading above 60 is typically interpreted as increasing buying strength, while readings above 80 may indicate overbought conditions. With XRP‚Äôs MFI climbing decisively past 60, Xaif Crypto is interpreting this as a confirmation of rising capital inflows into the asset. In other words, whales appear to be loading up on XRP at lower levels, potentially anticipating a breakout once market sentiment aligns with technical strength. This renewed buying pressure comes at a critical moment for XRP. The token has been consolidating within a tight range for weeks, with traders watching closely for signs of directional bias. Whale accumulation historically precedes larger price swings, as their significant holdings can absorb selling pressure and tilt market momentum. If accumulation continues, XRP could establish a stronger support base, giving bulls room to challenge the psychological level of $3.0 with the present price standing at $2.96. Meanwhile, SBI Holdings is driving XRP‚Äôs future with major investments, deep Ripple partnerships, and accelerating real-world adoption in global payments. Ripple‚Äôs XRP Poised to Transform SWIFT with Real-Time, Two-Way Settlement According to crypto observer SMQKE, Ripple‚Äôs technology, powered by its native asset XRP, has the potential to enhance the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) network. Traditionally, SWIFT has operated as a secure messaging system for banks and financial institutions, facilitating the communication needed to initiate and confirm cross-border transactions. However, it does not move money itself, leaving settlements to rely on correspondent banking chains that can be slow, costly, and error-prone. SMQKE highlights that Ripple‚Äôs approach could revolutionize this process by shifting SWIFT from a one-way messaging platform into a two-way communication and settlement network. Using XRP as a bridge currency, RippleNet enables direct integration with banks‚Äô existing databases and ledgers, allowing transactions to settle in real time instead of merely being messaged and then reconciled later. This innovation would eliminate multiple intermediaries, reduce settlement risk, and cut costs associated with liquidity management. Unlike SWIFT, which only sends payment instructions requiring separate reconciliation, Ripple enables instant value transfer, validating, clearing, and settling in real time. Its two-way model keeps both sides synchronized, eliminating delays and failures common in legacy systems. Such integration could revolutionize finance, enabling banks to settle payments faster and more transparently while cutting reliance on costly nostro/vostro accounts. For businesses and consumers, it means cheaper, quicker, and more accessible cross-border transactions. In remittance-dependent regions, the impact could be truly transformative. Therefore, this convergence wouldn‚Äôt replace SWIFT but transform it from a passive messaging system into an active settlement layer. As demand for faster, cheaper, and more reliable payments accelerates, Ripple‚Äôs integration of XRP with SWIFT could redefine cross-border finance and mark a pivotal shift in the global monetary system. Conclusion Ripple‚Äôs integration of XRP into SWIFT‚Äôs framework would not simply modernize global payments, it could redefine them. title: Exciting Binance Perpetual Futures: Unlocking FLOCK and SKY Trading!
body: BitcoinWorld Exciting Binance Perpetual Futures: Unlocking FLOCK and SKY Trading! Binance is once again expanding its derivatives offerings, bringing new and thrilling opportunities for traders worldwide. The recent announcement to list FLOCK and SKY perpetual futures contracts is generating considerable buzz across the crypto community, inviting both seasoned and new participants to explore these dynamic instruments. This move further solidifies Binance‚Äôs position as a leader in the cryptocurrency derivatives market, continuously innovating to meet trader demands for diverse assets and advanced trading tools. Understanding these new listings, especially within the context of Binance perpetual futures , is crucial for anyone looking to capitalize on market movements. What Are Binance Perpetual Futures, and Why Do They Matter? Perpetual futures contracts are a popular type of derivative in the cryptocurrency market. Unlike traditional futures, they do not have an expiry date, allowing traders to hold positions indefinitely. This flexibility is a significant draw for many. Binance, as a premier exchange, offers these contracts, enabling users to speculate on the price movements of various cryptocurrencies without actually owning the underlying asset. These contracts are especially appealing due to the leverage they offer. Leverage allows traders to open larger positions with a relatively small amount of capital. For the newly listed FLOCK and SKY contracts, Binance is providing up to 75x leverage. This means a small price movement can lead to significant gains, or conversely, substantial losses. Therefore, while the potential for profit is amplified, so too is the risk. Dive into FLOCK and SKY: The Latest Binance Perpetual Futures Listings Binance has officially announced the upcoming listing of FLOCK/USDT and SKY/USDT perpetual contracts. The FLOCK/USDT contract is set to go live at 6:45 a.m. UTC on September 9th. Shortly after, the SKY/USDT perpetual contract will become available for trading at 7:00 a.m. UTC on the same day. These specific timings provide traders with a clear schedule to prepare their strategies. Both listings will support up to 75x leverage, a feature that attracts high-risk, high-reward traders. The addition of FLOCK and SKY to the extensive list of Binance perpetual futures expands the options available for diversification and strategic trading. Traders can now access more niche or emerging assets within a highly liquid and robust trading environment provided by Binance. Navigating the Excitement: Benefits and Risks of Binance Perpetual Futures Trading Binance perpetual futures offers several compelling benefits. Firstly, the high leverage allows traders to maximize their capital efficiency, potentially generating higher returns from smaller market movements. Secondly, the 24/7 nature of the crypto market means these contracts can be traded at any time, offering continuous opportunities. Furthermore, perpetual futures enable traders to profit from both rising and falling markets through long and short positions. However, it is crucial to acknowledge the inherent risks. The same leverage that amplifies gains can also magnify losses, leading to rapid liquidation if the market moves against a position. Cryptocurrency markets are notoriously volatile, and sudden price swings are common. Therefore, effective risk management, including setting stop-loss orders and understanding margin requirements, is paramount for anyone engaging with Binance perpetual futures . Smart Strategies for Trading Binance Perpetual Futures To navigate the dynamic world of Binance perpetual futures effectively, consider these actionable insights: Start Small: Especially if you are new to futures trading, begin with smaller position sizes to understand market dynamics and leverage effects. Utilize Risk Management Tools: Always set stop-loss orders to limit potential losses. Furthermore, do not over-leverage, as this significantly increases liquidation risk. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of market news, technical analysis, and fundamental developments related to FLOCK, SKY, and the broader crypto market. Practice with a Demo Account: If available, practice trading in a simulated environment before committing real capital. Diversify: While FLOCK and SKY offer new opportunities, avoid putting all your capital into a single asset. By adopting a disciplined approach and continuously learning, traders can better position themselves to capitalize on the opportunities presented by these new listings. The introduction of FLOCK and SKY perpetual futures contracts on Binance marks an exciting development for the crypto derivatives landscape. These new offerings provide traders with expanded choices and the potential for significant gains through high leverage. However, success in this volatile market hinges on a clear understanding of the instruments, diligent risk management, and a well-informed trading strategy. As the market continues to evolve, Binance remains at the forefront, offering cutting-edge tools for the modern crypto trader. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What are FLOCK and SKY, and what kind of projects do they represent? FLOCK and SKY are cryptocurrencies, each representing different blockchain projects or ecosystems. While the announcement focuses on their trading availability, it‚Äôs always advisable for traders to research the underlying utility and fundamentals of any asset before trading. 2. What does ‚Äòup to 75x leverage‚Äô mean for traders? Up to 75x leverage means a trader can open a position worth 75 times their initial margin. For example, with $100 of capital, you can control a position worth up to $7,500. While this can amplify profits, it equally amplifies potential losses and liquidation risk. 3. Are Binance perpetual futures suitable for beginners? Perpetual futures trading, especially with high leverage, carries significant risk and is generally more suitable for experienced traders who understand market volatility and risk management. Beginners should approach with extreme caution, start with small amounts, and thoroughly educate themselves. 4. How can I manage risk when trading FLOCK and SKY perpetual futures? Effective risk management includes setting stop-loss orders to limit potential losses, using appropriate position sizing, avoiding over-leveraging, and continuously monitoring your positions. Never invest more than you can afford to lose. 5. What is the difference between a perpetual future and a traditional future? The main difference is the expiry date. Traditional futures contracts have a set expiry date, after which they settle. Perpetual futures, however, do not have an expiry date, allowing traders to hold positions indefinitely as long as they meet margin requirements. title: OpenAI may leave California if regulators block its for-profit restructuring
body: OpenAI is warning that it might leave California entirely as legal fights and political backlash threaten to kill its restructuring plans. Executives are weighing a possible exit after realizing the state‚Äôs attorney general could block the company‚Äôs move to become a for-profit operation. The company‚Äôs entire future now hinges on getting regulatory approval, or risking losing nearly $19 billion in investor cash. According to reporting from The Wall Street Journal , OpenAI is being targeted by some of California‚Äôs biggest nonprofit coalitions, labor unions, and philanthropic groups. These organizations want the attorney general to investigate whether the company‚Äôs restructuring would break state charity laws. Attorneys General threaten legal action if restructure proceeds California and Delaware‚Äôs attorneys general are both investigating the proposal. They‚Äôve got legal power to sue or demand changes if they believe OpenAI is violating nonprofit law. The office of California‚Äôs attorney general is already warning that OpenAI‚Äôs current plan may go against its original mission. The state sent a letter raising concerns, especially in light of multiple suicides reported by people who interacted with ChatGPT over extended periods. In the letter, regulators wrote, ‚ÄúThe recent deaths are unacceptable. They have rightly shaken the American public‚Äôs confidence in OpenAI and this industry.‚Äù They told OpenAI that safety must come first. They also made it clear the company‚Äôs nonprofit status requires transparency and a public-first approach to AI deployment. Executives inside OpenAI didn‚Äôt expect this kind of pushback when they announced the restructure late last year. The intensity of the legal pressure, especially from California, has turned into a real threat. Sam Altman, who co-founded OpenAI in 2015, built the company into an $86 billion AI powerhouse, but now he‚Äôs at risk of watching it fall apart over legal technicalities. OpenAI is still run as a for-profit unit under a nonprofit parent, and that structure doesn‚Äôt sit well with big investors. They‚Äôre not getting traditional shares and want the change fast. Those investors have already promised billions, but only if the new company can legally issue stock. Without the restructure, OpenAI could lose the cash it needs to stay in the AI arms race. Projects like building custom chips, setting up new data centers, and fighting off poaching from rivals are all on the line. There‚Äôs also pressure to reduce huge yearly losses and wrestle back more control from Microsoft, which has a massive stake in the business. OpenAI hires political allies and concedes to critics OpenAI has been scrambling for political support. The company hired several advisers tied to California Governor Gavin Newsom, including former Senator Laphonza Butler. They‚Äôve spent the summer hosting closed-door meetings with advocacy groups across the state and promised to pour $50 million into nonprofits and communities. In May, the company made a key concession. Instead of separating the nonprofit and for-profit sides, executives agreed the nonprofit would stay in charge of the new company. Internally, that was seen as a blow for Sam and his investors, but it was the only way to calm some of the opposition. Despite the changes, the heat hasn‚Äôt gone down. Meta has asked California officials to stop the restructuring. Elon Musk offered to take control of OpenAI‚Äôs assets earlier this year but got rejected. He‚Äôs now suing the company through his rival AI startup xAI , saying the restructure breaks the original nonprofit agreement. The trial is scheduled for next year, and OpenAI says the lawsuit is ‚Äúbaseless.‚Äù In April, a group of more than 60 nonprofits led by the San Francisco Foundation demanded an investigation into whether OpenAI has violated its federal tax-exempt status. In a letter, they warned that without enforcement, more tech startups might abuse nonprofit structures to benefit private investors. ‚ÄúOther startups, looking at OpenAI as a model, are likely to consider whether to take similar advantage,‚Äù they wrote. Meanwhile, OpenAI is trying to fix public concerns. Bret Taylor, chairman of the board, said they‚Äôre working on adding parental controls to ChatGPT and tackling ‚Äúsycophancy,‚Äù a flaw where the AI agrees too easily with users. ‚ÄúWe are fully committed to addressing the Attorneys General‚Äôs concerns,‚Äù Bret said. Want your project in front of crypto‚Äôs top minds? Feature it in our next industry report, where data meets impact.

title: What Does It Take for Bulls to Regain Control in Bitcoin? Here‚Äôs the Answer
body: Weak US employment data, new tariffs, the war in Europe and the Middle East, and the political crisis in France have increased global uncertainties this week. While gold is climbing to record highs, Bitcoin maintains its high correlation with the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 index. Cryptocurrency research firm Ecoinometrics, in its assessment of X, said, ‚ÄúBitcoin's correlation regime is still tied to risky assets. The separation into digital gold has not yet occurred.‚Äù Data shows that Bitcoin's correlation with gold is near zero. It also has almost no correlation with traditional safe-haven US Treasury bonds. Ethereum, however, trades even more closely with risk assets than Bitcoin. Markets will be watching next week's Fed meeting. According to Ecoinometrics, macroeconomic uncertainty must diminish for the bull market to gain momentum. ‚ÄúThe best-case scenario is for the Fed to confirm that it will either remain committed to its interest rate cut path or accelerate the process,‚Äù the report stated. However, if the opposite happens‚Äîa hawkish surprise‚Äîboth tech stocks and Bitcoin are expected to take a hit. Andr√© Dragosch, Head of European Research at Bitwise, also stated that the volatility in the crypto market is due to macro developments, saying, ‚ÄúThe current weak performance is not due to micro developments, but to the decline in global growth expectations and the decrease in investors‚Äô risk appetite.‚Äù Related News: Major Hacking Incident Occurs: Large Amount of Solana (SOL) Stolen - Here Are the Details However, Dragosch stated that he remained optimistic about the medium- to long-term outlook: ‚ÄúI remain very bullish due to the acceleration in global liquidity growth. The Fed's continued interest rate cuts and the continued easing of financial conditions will likely create a positive environment for markets.‚Äù However, Dragosch noted that downside risks are still on the table in the short term, saying the Fed meeting has become a ‚Äúdouble event‚Äù for Bitcoin: ‚ÄúAn aggressive cut will send risky assets soaring, and if dovish expectations are disappointed, Bitcoin will be dragged down along with tech stocks.‚Äù *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: What Does It Take for Bulls to Regain Control in Bitcoin? Here‚Äôs the Answer

title: Energy Asset Data On-Chain: Ant Digital‚Äôs Massive $8.4B Push into Renewable Blockchain
body: BitcoinWorld Energy Asset Data On-Chain: Ant Digital‚Äôs Massive $8.4B Push into Renewable Blockchain Imagine a future where every watt of renewable energy generated is meticulously recorded and verified, creating a transparent and efficient ecosystem. This isn‚Äôt a distant dream; it‚Äôs becoming a reality as Ant Digital Technologies embarks on a monumental journey to put a staggering $8.4 billion worth of energy asset data on-chain . This pioneering move by the blockchain arm of China‚Äôs Ant Group signals a significant shift in how we manage and monetize green energy, promising to unlock new levels of transparency and liquidity for real-world assets. What Does Putting Energy Asset Data On-Chain Really Mean? Ant Digital Technologies is making headlines with its ambitious plan to upload 60 billion yuan, equivalent to approximately $8.43 billion, worth of energy asset data onto its proprietary AntChain blockchain. This isn‚Äôt just a small-scale pilot; it involves the operational data from more than 15 million renewable energy devices. Think about it: Wind turbines: Their performance, generation metrics, and maintenance logs. Solar panels: Their daily output, efficiency rates, and environmental impact. By bringing this vast amount of information onto a blockchain, Ant Digital aims to create an immutable, transparent, and verifiable record. This foundational step is crucial for building trust and efficiency within the renewable energy sector. Why is Energy Asset Data On-Chain a Game-Changer for Renewables? The decision to place such critical information on a blockchain isn‚Äôt just about technology; it‚Äôs about transforming an entire industry. Putting energy asset data on-chain offers several compelling benefits: Enhanced Transparency: Every data point, from energy generation to consumption, becomes auditable and verifiable. This can significantly boost confidence in green energy claims and carbon credit markets. Operational Efficiency: Streamlined data management reduces manual processes and potential errors, leading to more efficient operations for renewable energy providers. New Monetization Avenues: With verifiable data, new financial products and services can emerge, such as tokenized carbon credits or energy derivatives, creating new revenue streams. Improved Trust: An immutable record fosters greater trust among stakeholders, including investors, regulators, and consumers, by providing undeniable proof of green energy production. Ultimately, this initiative has the potential to accelerate the global transition to sustainable energy by making the entire ecosystem more robust and accountable. Unlocking Liquidity: Real-World Assets and Energy Asset Data On-Chain Beyond simply recording data, Ant Group is exploring an even more revolutionary aspect: linking this data to real-world asset (RWA) tokenization. The company recently completed a substantial 300 million yuan ($42.1 million) funding round, indicating serious intent. The goal is to issue related tokens on decentralized exchanges (DEXs). This means: Real-World Assets (RWAs): These are tangible or intangible assets from the physical world, like real estate, art, or in this case, the value derived from renewable energy production, that are represented on a blockchain. Increased Liquidity: By tokenizing these assets, they can be traded more easily and efficiently on blockchain networks, opening them up to a wider pool of investors. This innovative approach to energy asset data on-chain could unlock immense liquidity for renewable energy projects, making it easier for them to attract investment and expand. However, it is crucial to note that this ambitious plan is currently pending regulatory approval, a common hurdle in the evolving landscape of blockchain finance. The Future of Green Energy: Blockchain‚Äôs Crucial Role Ant Digital‚Äôs move to put energy asset data on-chain is more than just a corporate strategy; it‚Äôs a potential blueprint for the future of sustainable finance and environmental, social, and governance (ESG) investing. If successful, this initiative could set a global precedent for how renewable energy assets are managed, verified, and monetized. The implications are far-reaching, potentially leading to: A standardized, transparent system for carbon accounting. Easier access to capital for green energy developers. Greater investor confidence in sustainable projects. While challenges such as scalability, regulatory clarity, and interoperability remain, the pioneering efforts of companies like Ant Digital are paving the way for a more integrated and efficient green economy powered by blockchain technology. In conclusion, Ant Digital Technologies is not just talking about the future of green energy; it is actively building it. By committing to put a massive $8.4 billion worth of energy asset data on-chain , the company is demonstrating the transformative power of blockchain. This move promises to usher in an era of unprecedented transparency, efficiency, and liquidity for the renewable energy sector, ultimately benefiting both the economy and the planet. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is Ant Digital Technologies? Ant Digital Technologies is the blockchain affiliate of China‚Äôs Ant Group, a leading financial technology company. It focuses on developing and applying blockchain solutions for various industries. What does ‚Äúputting energy asset data on-chain‚Äù mean? It means uploading operational data from renewable energy devices, such as wind turbines and solar panels, onto a blockchain network. This creates an immutable, transparent, and verifiable record of energy generation and other relevant metrics. How much data is Ant Digital planning to put on-chain? Ant Digital plans to put 60 billion yuan, or approximately $8.43 billion, worth of energy asset data on-chain. This includes data from over 15 million renewable energy devices. What are Real-World Assets (RWAs) in this context? In this context, Real-World Assets (RWAs) refer to the value derived from renewable energy production or the assets themselves, which can be tokenized and represented on a blockchain to increase their liquidity and tradability. What are the potential benefits of this initiative? The initiative aims to enhance transparency, improve operational efficiency, unlock new monetization avenues through RWA tokenization, and build greater trust within the renewable energy sector, accelerating the global transition to sustainable energy. Did you find this article insightful? Share it with your network to spread the word about Ant Digital‚Äôs groundbreaking move in the renewable energy sector! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping blockchain institutional adoption. title: Bybit taps Sygnum Bank for Swiss-regulated custody and off-exchange settlement
body: In this post: Bybit has partnered with Sygnum Bank to provide institutional clients with secure and off-exchange custody of their digital assets via the Sygnum Protect Platform. The collaboration allows the exchange‚Äôs clients to hold assets off-balance sheet at Sygnum Bank while trading spot and derivatives on Bybit. Asset balances on the exchange and trading P&L will be settled automatically every eight hours for capital efficiency and operational transparency. Bybit has partnered with global digital asset group Sygnum to provide institutional clients with secure, off-exchange custody. The world‚Äôs second-largest crypto exchange by trading volume said it will offer off-exchange custody through the Sygnum Protect Platform. Bybit said the collaboration with the bank positions the company as a trusted partner for institutions. The integration combines the crypto exchange‚Äôs broad product range and deep liquidity with the bank-grade security of Swiss-regulated custody. Bybit hopes to strengthen institutional crypto security Counterparty risk awareness in the crypto industry moves in cycles, with peaks triggered by major crises. The Bybit hack, arguably the most significant risk-off event since the FTX collapse in November 2022, is shaping up to be the catalyst for the next wave of heightened‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/TAxkI1Nra6 ‚Äî Sygnum Bank (@sygnumofficial) February 26, 2025 The Dubai-based crypto exchange revealed that its clients can now hold assets off-balance sheet at Sygnum Bank while trading spot and derivatives on Bybit. The initiative will instantly mirror asset balances on the exchange. According to Bybit, trading P&L will also be settled automatically every eight hours to ensure both capital efficiency and operational transparency. Bybit said it chose Sygnum Protect because it‚Äôs the largest bank-operated Off-Exchange Custody platform. The bank also currently covers crypto exchanges that collectively account for over 50% of global spot and derivatives volumes. The crypto exchange said the initiative reinforces its commitment to providing institutional investors with the highest standards of security, resilience, and trust. Sygnum integrates multiple security layers, including advanced software-hardware controls, strict governance and independent audits. The bank also integrates the legal protection of bankruptcy-remote asset custody under Swiss banking law. The crypto exchange argued that Sygnum‚Äôs security measures give institutional clients peace of mind that their assets are safeguarded even in times of market uncertainty. Dominic Lohberger, Sygnum‚Äôs chief product officer, said the organization is committed to working with leading exchanges to enhance the resilience of the crypto industry and empower institutions to trade with peace of mind. He noted that the rapid adoption of Sygnum Project by institutional clients trading on Binance, Deribit, and now Bybit, suggests the urgent need for bank-grade, off-balance sheet custody solutions. Bybit plans to expand its custody ecosystem Bybit said it plans to expand its custody ecosystem, having built a robust network of trusted custody partners, including Fireblocks, Copper, and Cactus. The firm said the custody ecosystem gives its clients flexibility and confidence in safeguarding their assets. ‚ÄúOur partnership with Sygnum Bank not only gives clients access to Bybit‚Äôs industry-leading products and liquidity, but also ensures their assets are safeguarded with the highest standards of Swiss banking. Together, we are building a secure and transparent foundation for institutions to trade with confidence.‚Äù -Yoyoo Wang, Head of Bybit‚Äôs Business-to-Business Unit (BBU). The B2B official also acknowledged that crypto and stablecoin infrastructure is evolving and managing counterparty risks is essential for further institutional adoption. The crypto exchange added that the collaboration with Sygnum Bank marks a new milestone in its strategy and will bring regulated, bank-grade off-exchange custody into the Bybit ecosystem. Sygnum revealed that the next phase of its roadmap will be to introduce automated collateral transfers between exchanges. The bank hopes to further enhance capital efficiency and asset allocation for institutional clients. Bybit also said the partnership complements its mission of creating a secure, transparent, and innovative trading environment for institutions to thrive in the crypto industry.
